Title.evidence: This randomized trial of short- versus long-term Dual AntiPlatelet Therapy for Stent-Assisted treatment of CErebral aneurysm (DAPTS ACE)

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomization was performed centrally through a web-based system.

Participants.evidence: Patients treated for cerebral aneurysm with SACE were enrolled from 17 hospitals in Japan.

Intervention.evidence: assigned in a 1:1 ratio to receive long-term (12 months) or short-term (3 months) DAPT with aspirin and clopidogrel.

Objective.evidence: aimed to clarify whether long-term DAPT can reduce the occurrence of ischemic stroke in patients with cerebral aneurysms treated by SACE compared with short-term DAPT.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the time to ischemic stroke event during 3 to 12 months after SACE.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was performed centrally through a web-based system.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 142 patients were recruited from November 4, 2016 to January 7, 2019.

Number_Analysed.evidence: 65 and 68 patients assigned to the long- and short-term DAPT groups, respectively, were included in the full analysis set.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The incidence rate did not differ between the groups (0.0 vs 2.1/100 person-years; log rank test, P=0.33).

Trial_Registration.evidence: This trial was registered with the Japan Registry of Clinical Trials (jRCTs051180141).
